course_title: Exercise-based rehabilitation, strength and conditioning in musculoskeletal, sports and exercise physiotherapy

learning_outcomes.description: Understand exercise induced adaptations and mal-adaptations.
Demonstrated an advance understanding of the use of exercise in the treatment and prevention of musculoskeletal, occupational and sports injuries and conditions, and chronic disease.
Demonstrate the ability to develop, implement and progress effective exercise programs at individual and population levels with understanding of pathological and adaptive timeframes.
Demonstrate the ability to develop and implement appropriate assessments and collection of outcome measure data to guide exercise prescription and progression.

assessments.task_description:
This assignment involves a review of the literature to build an evidence informed approach to your practice.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment items will attract a penalty of 10% of the mark per day late or, for work graded on a 1-7 scale, a deduction of one grade per day (including weekends and public holidays), unless a formal extension has been organised prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to design an exercise program for a patient / client returning from an injury to either sport or work.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment items will attract a penalty of 10% of the mark per day late or, for work graded on a 1-7 scale, a deduction of one grade per day (including weekends and public holidays), unless a formal extension has been organised prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
You will participate in an online oral examination (Viva Voce), where you will give a short presentation, respond to questions, and provide reflections on your PHTY7953 Exercise Program Written Assignment.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Assessment Procedure (95)

When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The viva voce will be conducted online using videoconferencing software.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 12(28 Jul - 26 Oct)

PHTY7953 Webcasts

Each week you will have access to 3-4 webcasts, totaling 1.5 to 2 hours.
